documentation.text: @dev Max burn factor. If less than this share would be left over after burning, we do a full burn instead. This is to avoid numerical instability in the adjustment factor.
@dev Total amount available for burning. Includes amounts marked for withdrawal but not yet withdrawn.
@notice Balance of given account that is available for withdrawal.
@notice Like balanceOf() but in adjusted amounts.

@notice Total amount contributed of a given account, consisting of the amount available for withdrawal and the
 amount that has already been marked for withdrawal.

@notice Like initiateWithdrawal() but operates on adjusted amounts. Convenient to withdraw all funds
 via `initiateWithdrawalAdjusted(balanceAdjustedOf(account))` without worrying about rounding issues.

documentation.text: @dev Burn `amountToBurn` or the whole pool, whichever is smaller. Do proper accounting.

GovernorChangeRequested(address).notice: Emmited when the governor is change is requested

GovernorChanged(address,address).notice: Emmited when the governor is changed

acceptGovernance().notice: Called by the pending governor to approve the change

balanceAdjustedOf(address).notice: Like balanceOf() but in adjusted amounts.

balanceOf(address).notice: Balance of given account that is available for withdrawal.

changeGovernor(address).notice: Changes the governor can only be called by the current governor

checkAndRun((uint256,(address,uint8,addr.notice: Variant of checkAndRun() where the reserve state is passed in; only callable by Motherboard.

checkAndRun().notice: Checks whether the reserve experiences a shortfall and the safety module should run and then runs it if so. This is called internally but can also be called by anyone.

claimableRewards(address).notice: returns the amount of claimable rewards by `beneficiary`

globalCheckpoint().details: these functions will be called internally but can typically be called by anyone to update the internal tracking state of the contract

initiateWithdrawalAdjusted(uint256).notice: Like initiateWithdrawal() but operates on adjusted amounts. Convenient to withdraw all funds via `initiateWithdrawalAdjusted(balanceAdjustedOf(account))` without worrying about rounding issues.

rewardsEmissionRate().notice: returns the number of rewards token that will be given per second for the contract This emission will be given to all stakers in the contract proportionally to their stake

shouldRun().notice: Whether the reserve should run under current conditions, i.e., whether it would run if `checkAndRun()` was called.

stakedBalanceOf(address).notice: the amount of tokens staked by `account`

startMining(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Deposit `amount` of the reward token from `rewardsFrom` and enable rewards until `endTime`. Typically governanceOnly. `amount` is spread evenly over the time period.

stopMining().notice: Stop liquidity mining early and reimburse leftover rewards to the DAO treasury. This may also be needed after the mining period has ended when we had `totalStaked() == 0` for a while, where no rewards accrue.

totalBalanceOf(address).notice: Total amount contributed of a given account, consisting of the amount available for withdrawal and the amount that has already been marked for withdrawal.

totalStaked().notice: the total amount of tokens staked in the contract

totalUnderlying().details: Total amount available for burning. Includes amounts marked for withdrawal but not yet withdrawn.

userCheckpoint(address).details: Update rewards accounting for user (see LiquidityMining.userCheckpoint()) and also update their position data in case of a full burn. It may look a bit ugly that these two things are mixed here but it's important to update them at the same time.

MAX_PARTIAL_BURN_FACTOR.details: Max burn factor. If less than this share would be left over after burning, we do a full burn instead. This is to avoid numerical instability in the adjustment factor.
